text: Duke of Edinburgh is good to get involved with and it could help with applications but it’s more about how the experience has given you skills to work in the field
For applications for physiotherapy it is really important to get work experience and not just in private practice or outpatients but in hospitals on wards and things as well
Aww nice! That was definitely one of my favourites as well! Okay, so are you planning on taking a year out of studying?
Okay wow, do quite a variety of sports then!

I quite like neuro physiotherapy but I’m still open to a lot of different areas, and when you qualify you rotate jobs into different areas so I’ll have a chance then to decide which area I like the most after gaining more experience :)
